title: Here’s why a rich guy going to space for a second time actually matters
summary: Polaris Dawn will be the first time that SpaceX employees have actually gone to space.

title: SabreSat: Redwire’s vehicle to dart through very low Earth orbit
summary: Redwire is designing SabreSat for government intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance missions.

title: China launches first Long March 6C rocket
summary: The new Long March 6C rocket successfully inserted four satellites into orbit late Monday on its debut flight.

title: Rocket Lab announces supplier agreements for military satellite project
summary: The company revealed payload and ground systems subcontractors for its Space Development Agency satellite contract

title: Rocket issue scrubs launch of Starliner crewed test flight
summary: Launch controllers scrubbed the first attempt to launch Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner on a crewed test flight May 6 because of a valve problem with the rocket.

title: It’s a Scrub for Boeing Starliner’s First Crewed Spaceflight
summary: The first crewed spaceflight of Boeing’s Starliner was scrubbed tonight because of an unexpected reading in an oxygen relief valve on the rocket’s upper stage. NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and […]

title: NGA to tap commercial satellites to patrol maritime hotspots
summary: The National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency announced its first commercial solutions opening to provide direct-to-warfighter commercial analytics for maritime domain awareness.

title: Search engine focused on Earth data gets new investors
summary: Danti’s $5 million seed round led by defense tech VC firm Shield Capital

title: Airbus to continue enhancing Pleiades Neo Next constellation
summary: Airbus will continue to improve its Pleiades Neo Next constellation rather than duplicating the capabilities of its two Pleiades Neo satellites.

title: Boeing’s Starliner set to launch first crew flight
summary: After years of anticipation, Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner capsule is ready to fly its first crew into space on the 100th flight of an Atlas V launch vehicle. Capping off Starliner’s test campaign, the Crew Flight Test (CFT) will send Barry Wilmore and Sunita Williams on a trajectory to rendezvous with the International Space Station (ISS) where they will remain for about a week. Liftoff is currently scheduled for May 6 at 10:34 PM EDT (02:34 UTC May 7), with Starliner expected to return to Earth on May 15.
